skill.name: Security Fundamentals
skill.description: Auto-invoke when reviewing authentication, authorization, input handling, data exposure, or any user-facing code. Enforces OWASP top 10 awareness and security-first thinking.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke when reviewing authentication, authorization, input handling, data exposure, or any user...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and checklists. No executable code, network access, filesystem operations, or external command execution. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Review code security and OWASP compliance
content.value_statement: Security vulnerabilities in code lead to data breaches and system compromise. This skill provides systematic checklists and OWASP Top 10 guidance for thorough security reviews during development.
actual_capabilities: Review authentication and login flows for security gaps
Check authorization and ownership verification in code
Identify injection vulnerabilities in database queries
Evaluate API responses for sensitive data exposure
Verify input validation and sanitization patterns
Apply OWASP Top 10 checklist to any codebase
limitations: Does not execute or test actual security controls
Does not scan dependencies for known vulnerabilities
Does not perform dynamic security testing or penetration testing
Requires developer to manually apply recommendations

use_cases.title: Standardize Security Reviews
use_cases.description: Apply consistent OWASP checklist across all pull requests to ensure no security gaps slip through.

use_cases.title: Secure API Endpoints
use_cases.description: Review authentication, authorization, and input handling in API code before deployment.

use_cases.title: Learn Security Patterns
use_cases.description: Use Socratic questions to understand why security controls are necessary and how to implement them.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Auth Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this authentication code for OWASP security issues. Check password handling, token security, and session management.

prompt_templates.title: API Security Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this API endpoint for authorization bugs, IDOR vulnerabilities, and sensitive data exposure in responses.

prompt_templates.title: Query Injection Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this database code for SQL injection vulnerabilities. Verify all queries use parameterized statements.

prompt_templates.title: Full Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security review of this codebase. Apply the OWASP Top 10 checklist and identify all potential vulnerabilities.

output_examples.input: Review this authentication code for security issues
output: ‚Ä¢ Passwords appear to be hashed using bcrypt - GOOD
‚Ä¢ Token has no expiration set - RISK: token theft vulnerability
‚Ä¢ No rate limiting on login endpoint - RISK: brute force attack
‚Ä¢ Consider adding: token expiration, rate limiting, failed login tracking

best_practices: Apply the skill to every pull request containing auth, API, or data handling code
Use the Socratic questions to help junior developers understand security principles
Run through the complete OWASP checklist before deploying to production
anti_patterns: Only reviewing security at the end of development instead of continuously
Trusting client-side validation without server-side verification
Returning full database objects instead of filtered API responses

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for comprehensive security review workflows.

faq.question: Does this skill scan for known CVEs?
faq.answer: No. This skill reviews code patterns for vulnerabilities. Use dependency scanners for CVE detection.

faq.question: How long does a security review take?
faq.answer: Typical reviews complete in seconds. Complex codebases may require multiple focused review prompts.

faq.question: Can this replace manual security testing?
faq.answer: No. Use this for code review during development. Manual testing and penetration testing remain necessary.

faq.question: Is my code sent externally for review?
faq.answer: No. All review happens locally within your AI tool. No code leaves your environment.

faq.question: How does this compare to SAST tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides human-readable security guidance. SAST tools automate vulnerability detection but lack context.
